forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 5pm. Sunny, with a high near 60. West wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog after 4am. Mostly clear, with a low around 49. West wind 5 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the city basks in intermittent sunshine as clouds drift lazily across the sky. With a hint of moisture lingering in the air, a slight chance of rain before five remains, yet the atmosphere feels mostly dry and pleasant, buoyed by a gentle west wind. The current temperature dances around a crisp sixty degrees, inviting layers that can adapt to the day’s shifting conditions. As daylight wanes, the fog begins to creep in, heralding a transition that will undoubtedly transform the skyline by dawn, cloaking the familiar sights in a captivating shroud of mist.

As the evening approaches, expect patchy fog to emerge after four, a soft blanket that brings a touch of mystery to the familiar streets. With temperatures dipping to around forty-nine, a cozy jacket will serve you well against the evening chill. This is a fitting time for an exploratory stroll along the Embarcadero, a leisurely visit to your favorite café, or simply unwinding at home with a good book as the fog settles, blanketing the vibrant city in a calm embrace. Embrace the elements, for they add texture to the tapestry of daily life in this remarkable place.
